revised_title: Thermodynamics of Crystalline Lattices: Monatomic Face-Centred Cubic Lattice
tldr: The author presents a new approach to the thermodynamics of crystalline lattices by formulating the thermodynamic functions in terms of phase-space averages of functions of the trace of the dynamical matrix. The theory is applied to a monatomic face-centred cubic lattice, determining the five microscopic force constants for aluminum. These constants are computed from experimental data on the elastic constants and high-temperature behavior of specific heat and calorimetric entropy.
